results.title: Ecstasy = Ekstase
results.brief_description: This controversial Czech film, featuring a very young Hedy Lamarr, gained international notoriety for its loose morals and a lengthy nude sequence. It was banned in America, Britain and Germany. The story follows a young woman’s search for love and fulfillment after she marries an unloving and much older man. Eventually she leaves him to return to the family home where she falls in love with a handsome young surveyor, but her husband discovers the affair and takes drastic action. The story is straightforward melodrama but an effortless sensuality and remarkable cinematography give the film a freshness and eloquence that is quite special.

results.title: Ecotourism: an experience with nature
results.creator_credit: Ben Cropp Productions, Seven Network Limited (Australia) and Ben Cropp
results.brief_description: What does the word “ecotourism” mean? By visiting some of Australia’s most exotic national parks, this program explains the concept. Resort owners and tour operators are attempting to provide quality experiences for tourists interested in nature without subjecting the local environment to the damage normally associated with tourism.

results.title: Ecotoons
results.creator_credit: WWF UK, Sally Richardson and Claire Breese
results.brief_description: Presented by Tony Robinson (Blackadder’s Baldrick), this World Wildlife Fund compilation of 30 international animated shorts is aimed at increasing awareness of environmental issues. Using claymation, stop start animation and computer animation, the tales cover a variety of issues such as pollution, overdevelopment, water and energy conservation, the dumping of toxic waste, recycling, logging, extinction and the depletion of the ozone layer. Also includes footage from the BBC series “Going live” in which a 12 year old viewer won a competition to have her storyboard for a “Morph” episode with a “green” theme brought to animated life by the Aardman studios. She visits Peter Lord at the studios who explains the animation process.

results.brief_description: SUMMARY: Based upon a home experiment kit for students, which deals quantitatively with the interaction of populations of the alga Chlorella and the water flea Daphnia. Dick Morris first sets up the differential equation describing the Chlorella populatio

results.title: Economics for elementary: trade
results.creator_credit: Oxford Films, Art Evans Productions, Arthur G. Evans and Ray Nanley
results.brief_description:
Explains the role of the middle-man in trade using the retailing of tomatoes as an example. shows the growing of the crop and the labour employed; the selling of the crop to the wholesaler (distributor); the wholesaler’s overheads and how he distributes to retail outlets such as supermarkets and markets.
Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Economic development
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Maslyn Williams and Ian Dunlop
results.brief_description: For the people of Papua and New Guinea the time when the family patch of land was the basis of society and the foundation of existence is passing. Commercial agriculture has been introduced and opportunities of wage earning are raising living standards. Main products are copra, coconut oil, coffee, and cocoa. Agricultural research stations have been established by the Administration for the benefit of both white settlers and native growers. Government Co-operative buying has been introduced and the new economic opportunities have enabled the people to become partners with the Administration. The cocoa industry is showing particularly rapid development.

results.title: Ecocide: A strategy of war
results.brief_description: This film looks at the aftermaths of the wars in Vietnam and Laos in terms of their effects on the ordinary peasant people who now face the enormous task of rebuilding their lives with primitive and limited resources. Shows how the dropping of daisy bombs from B-52s, and the spraying chemical herbicides caused massive destruction to the rural environment. Photographed and narrated by Dr E.W. Pfeiffer. Audio reports from the war zone recorded by Dr Pfeiffer and Dr A.H. Westing. B-52 scenes from “Year of the Tiger” written by Dr Pfeiffer with the help of Dr Westing.

results.title: Eclipses of the sun and moon
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and William Kay

results.title: Eclipse '73
results.creator_credit: Service du film de Research Scientifique and Gilbert Dassonville
results.brief_description: A report on the solar eclipse of June 30, 1973 seen from the ground and from a plane. The 1973 eclipse was monitored in Africa, south of the Sahara. Deals with the considerable means employed by the international scientific community while showing the mechanics of an eclipse and its value for basic research. At Atar in the heart of the Mauritanian desert together with other Soviet, Japanese, Dutch and Italian scientists, the French mission brought in more than 20 tons of equipment, and used the most advanced technological means. The use of a supersonic Concorde 001, especially equipped by aerospace for this flight enabled them for the first time to monitor an eclipse for 74 minutes.
